text: Britain needs a labour party that can
rebuild after this defeat so we can have
a government that stands up for working
people again and now it's time for
someone else to take forward the
leadership of this party so I'm
tendering my resignation taking effect
after this afternoon's commemoration a
VE day at the Cenotaph I want to do so
straightaway because the party needs to
have an open and honest debate about the
right way forward without constraint I
always expected this election to be
exceptionally difficult for the Liberal
Democrats given the heavy
responsibilities we've had to bear in
government in the most challenging of
circumstances but clearly the results
have been immeasurably more crushing and
unkind than I could ever have feared for
that of course I must take
responsibility and therefore I announce
that I will be resigning as leader of
the Liberal Democrats a leadership
election will now take place according
to the party's rules I said as this
campaign went on that if I didn't win I
would stand down as leader of UK and I
know that you and the media are used to
party leaders making endless promises
that they don't actually keep but I'm a
man of a word I don't break the word so
I should be writing to the UK you get
national executive in a few minutes
saying that I am standing down as leader
of you kit
